snippet: The average prices of new homes in 70 major cities fell 0.5 percent from the previous month, accelerating from May’s 0.2 percent drop.
abstract: Reports show that new home prices in China fell for second consecutive month and are expected to continue to decline; trend presents challenge for Beijing, putting further pressure on economy if prices fall too sharply.
lead_paragraph: The average prices of new homes in 70 major cities fell 0.5 percent from the previous month, accelerating from May’s 0.2 percent drop.

headline.main: In China, New-Home Prices Declined in June
headline.print_headline: In China, New-Home Prices Declined in June
